title: Rookie quarterbacks Tyler Shough, Cam Ward duel feature in Mic'd Up
description: NFL Films was watching when Tyler Shough and Cam Ward dueled in Week 17. Here's a look at both rookie quarterbacks, who were Mic'd Up on game day.
fullText:
This year's two best rookie competed head to head last week, and they didn't disappoint. New Orleans Saints passer Tyler Shough and Tennessee Titans first overall pick Cam Ward were featured in a Mic'd Up clip from NFL Films to give us a look at each rookie's day at the office. It's clear they both have a strong presence, but you can see why guys are rallying around Shough after the Saints had a rough start to the season.

"Do your job all day," Shough said in the huddle, "Great feet, great eyes, great technique. Make a play."

It's also clear that Shough has developed great chemistry with his leading wide receiver Chris Olave. He approached Olave on the bench late in regulation to tell him, "We got to throw the ball to win the game. Throw the ball to win the game so whatever it takes bro." After connecting with Olave on a touchdown pass, the pair celebrated all the way back to the bench.

"Oh my God. Oh my God," Shough gasped, leaping to chest-bump Olave. "I told you I'm gonna get you."

Shough vs Ward Mic'd Up üîä

Just 2 rising rookies putting on a clinic@Saints | @Titans | @InsideTheNFL pic.twitter.com/j6bm1njj8t

‚Äî NFL Films (@NFLFilms) December 31, 2025

It's a really cool look at how Shough conducts himself on game days. And from the loud reactions of his offensive linemen and other teammates after big plays, his positive energy is infectious. Win or lose in Week 18's season finale with the Atlanta Falcons, it sure looks like the Saints have found their guy.

This article originally appeared on Saints Wire: NFL Films features Saints rookie Tyler Shough, Titans QB Cam Ward

title: These are leading contenders for the 2026 Dakar Rally
description: The 48th edition of the world's biggest cross-country rally is nearly upon us. Here‚Äôs a look at the main contenders for victory in Dakar
fullText:
The 2026 Dakar Rally is shaping up to deliver one of the most closely fought battles in recent years. Ford and Dacia arrive in Saudi Arabia determined to apply the lessons they learned on their debut last year with the aim of ending Toyota‚Äôs dominance in the world‚Äôs most prestigious rally-raid. Toyota isn‚Äôt standing still either, and has introduced an all-new car to maintain its position at the front.

The rally itself features several changes, with both the route and the format having been altered by organiser ASO to add a fresh challenge.

Following the ceremonial start and Prologue on 3 January, competitors will tackle nearly 8,000km across two weeks, crossing some of the most unforgiving terrain in the Middle East.

Here‚Äôs a list of drivers considered to be the favourites for top honours in the Ultimate category:

One of the prime contenders for the 2026 Dakar Rally is reigning champion Yazeed Al-Rajhi. The Saudi billionaire had always been rapid in cross-country rallying, with Dakar‚Äôs move to his home country in 2020 cementing his position as a frontrunner. But last year he made the biggest strides, combining his raw pace with improved maturity to secure a maiden win against factory competition. Back at the wheel of a Toyota and supported by the highly experienced Overdrive customer team, he has all the ingredients required to defend his crown.

That said, the 44-year-old‚Äôs build-up to this year‚Äôs event has been far from ideal. A heavy crash at Baja Aragon in April left him with fractured vertebrae, forcing a lengthy spell on the sidelines. He returned to competition in Portugal with a subdued 22nd-place finish before his preparations suffered another setback when he retired from Rally Morocco.

Toyota‚Äôs charge in Dakar will be spearheaded by Henk Lategan. At 31 years of age, he is one of the younger drivers in the field, but with four Dakar appearances already under his belt, he appears ready to finally seal the crown. The South African proved in 2025 that he is capable of fighting for the overall victory, as he went toe-to-toe with the more experienced Al-Rajhi and claimed two individual stage wins along the way. Missing out on the top spot by just under four minutes will have only sharpened his determination to go one better this time around.

Toyota has a new weapon in Dakar this year in the form of the GR DKR Hilux, which features a lighter tubular chassis and reinforced transmission. The Japanese manufacturer has won Dakar three times in the last four years, and the updated model based on the Hilux pick-up will help stave off competition from newer rivals.

If there is one driver the Dakar field can never afford to underestimate, it is Nasser Al-Attiyah. The Qatari has been a relentless winning force over the past decade and arrives in 2026 determined to reclaim the crown after two comparatively difficult campaigns in 2024 and 2025. While Stephane Peterhansel‚Äôs record of eight outright victories in cars remains some distance away, Al-Attiyah could enhance his legacy by winning the rally with a fourth different manufacturer after his previous triumphs with Volkswagen, Mini and Toyota. Further, he is just one stage win away from leapfrogging both Peterhansel and Ari Vatanen to become the most successful Dakar driver in that metric.

Al-Attiyah will also be able to benefit from an improved Dacia Sandrider, which won in both Abu Dhabi and Morocco last year after a rather underwhelming debut in Dakar at the start of the 2025 season.

Carlos Sainz Sr. shows no signs of slowing as he prepares for his 19th Dakar Rally start at the age of 63. Sainz became the oldest driver to win the world‚Äôs most prestigious cross-country rally when he won the 2024 edition at the wheel of the Audi RS Q e-tron. His 2025 outing was cut short by a crash on Stage 2, but he is back this year to gun for a fifth overall victory.

Winning Dakar with Ford would bring his career a full circle, having made his WRC debut back in 1987 at the wheel of a Cosworth-powered Sierra. Sainz also never managed to win a WRC title with the American marque (his 1990 and ‚Äò92 championships were won with Toyota), so a Dakar triumph with Raptor would be one of the most satisfying achievements of his illustrious career.

Rally legend Sebastien Loeb arrives at Dakar with renewed momentum after closing out the 2025 World Rally-Raid Championship with three consecutive podiums, including a victory in the season-ending Morocco Rally. That should give him some encouragement after his most recent Dakar outing ended early due to car damage. Loeb will also have a new co-driver in the form of Al-Attiyah‚Äôs former navigator Edouard Boulanger. After a run of misfortune earlier in 2025, Loeb felt a reset was required, leading to a split with Fabian Lurquin, who has moved across to partner Al-Attiyah in a direct swap between the pair.

It remains to be seen if Dacia can build on its recent success and take on Toyota on the biggest stage, but a maiden Dakar victory for Loeb would be huge for his career, especially after Sebastien Ogier drew level with him on nine World Rally Championship titles in 2025.

Mattias Ekstrom‚Äôs recent Dakar form has been so convincing that he is now viewed less as a two-time DTM champion and more as a genuine rally-raid specialist. The Swede has shown a remarkable ability to adapt to new disciplines, a trait underlined in 2022 when he beat his more experienced Audi team-mates to finish ninth overall on debut.

That adaptability was again on display in 2025 when, after ending a decades-long association with Audi, he guided the factory Ford team to the podium, finishing behind only the dominant Toyotas of Al-Rajhi and Lategan.

How Ekstrom builds on that impressive performance will be one of the key storylines in 2026, particularly if Ford can produce a package capable of taking the Hilux head-on in Saudi Arabia.

Beyond the established leading sextet, several other drivers on the entry list are capable of springing a surprise in 2026. Toyota driver Seth Quintero, for instance, will be a much more potent force in his third outing in the Ultimate category. Also stepping into a bigger role is two-time bike champion Toby Price, whose impressive Dakar debut in the car category with Overdrive last year earned him a promotion to Toyota‚Äôs factory line-up.

Another driver to watch out for is Lucas Moraes, who won the 2025 W2RC title with Toyota and has since joined an expanded four-car Dacia operation alongside Al-Attiyah, Loeb and Cristina Gutierrez.

Ford‚Äôs young gun Mitch Guthrie complemented Ekstrom well in 2025 and looks well placed to challenge for individual stage wins this year. His team-mate Nani Roma, a Dakar winner on both two and four wheels, should also never be discounted.

Outside of Toyota, Ford and Dacia, two smaller manufacturers could regularly mix in the top 10 this year: Century and Mini. At Century, Matthieu Serradori and Brian Baragwanath have a history of punching above their team‚Äôs weight, while Mini also fields proven talents like Guillaume de Mevius and Lionel Baud.

Finally, ‚ÄòMr Dakar‚Äô Peterhansel will also line up at the start in Yanbu on 3 January after missing the event in 2025, competing for Land Rover‚Äôs Defender brand in the Stock class.

Dakar 2026: Full route, schedule and marathon stage details

Red Bull co-owner Mark Mateschitz¬†to enter Dakar Rally under an alias

title: Serie A: F√ºllkrug joins AC Milan from West Ham
description: The transfer of Germany forward Niclas F√ºllkrug from West Ham United to AC Milan appears completed as he was included in the Serie A list of transfers on Friday. The league wrote "temporary" which should confirm that the 32-year-old joins the Rossonieri on loan until the end of the season.
fullText:
The transfer of Germany forward Niclas F√ºllkrug from West Ham United to AC Milan appears completed as he was included in the Serie A list of transfers on Friday.

The league wrote "temporary" which should confirm that the 32-year-old joins the Rossonieri on loan until the end of the season.

Neither Milan nor West Ham have announced the deal so far.

F√ºllkrug was seen in Milan before Christmas, possibly undergoing the mandatory medical at the nine-time European champions.

He joined West Ham in 2024 from Borussia Dortmund for ‚Ç¨30 million (35.2 million). But he never made a real breakthrough at the Hammers and had several injury setbacks.

F√ºllkrug will hope for more playing time at Milan in a bid to return into the Germany squad for this year's World Cup. He has 24 caps and 14 goals, with his last match in June.

Milan are second in Serie A, one point behind crosstown rivals Inter, going into their match at Cagliari on Friday night.

title: Wales hope 'genius' Bellamy stays amid club interest
description: Wales head coach Craig Bellamy is attracting interest from clubs ‚Äì but FAW boss Noel Mooney hopes he will stay until Euro 2028.
fullText:
Wales head coach Craig Bellamy is attracting interest from clubs ‚Äì but Football Association of Wales (FAW) chief executive Noel Mooney hopes the man he describes as a "genius" will stay until Euro 2028.

After being linked with the Celtic job following Brendan Rodgers' departure in October, Bellamy said he was "fully committed" to Wales.

The 46-year-old signed a four-year contract when he was appointed Wales boss in July 2024 and has impressed in his first senior managerial role.

Under Bellamy, Wales have earned promotion to the Nations League top flight and, if they win their World Cup play-off semi-final and final in March, they will qualify for next summer's tournament in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

Bellamy has also introduced a bold and attacking new style of play, which has caught the attention of club sides ‚Äì if not a formal approach, according to Mooney.

"No [approach] but there's interest around Craig. Wherever I go you hear that because of the way he plays football," Mooney told BBC Sport Wales.

"If I was the CEO of a football club and I wanted to play beautiful, expansive football, I'd be looking at him to be frank because he is just such a good coach and he's got a backroom team around him that's fabulous as well.

"It's natural he's going to create interest in the future. We're completely prepared for that."

Former Liverpool and Manchester City forward Bellamy earned 78 caps for Wales and scored 19 goals but never represented his country at a major tournament.

That is a major factor in his burning desire to take Wales to the 2026 World Cup, and he has said that managing the national team at Euro 2028 on home soil is a "massive" incentive.

Wales will co-host Euro 2028 alongside England, Scotland and the Republic of Ireland, with Cardiff's Principality Stadium staging the opening fixture.

"I was with him at the rugby when Wales played the All Blacks [in November] and we're just looking around the stadium together, thinking when we kick off Euro 2028 in this stadium as a full house, that'll be another chapter for Welsh football," said Mooney.

"So as part of the legacy that he wants to leave for Welsh football, we would love him to stay to Euro 2028 and to lead the team.

"He's really enthusiastic about that. We live in the real world as well. If someone comes on and offers him, I don't know, the Real Madrid job or Barcelona job or the Liverpool job, whatever it is, then naturally that's interesting for anybody.

"I mean he's competitive, he's got to the very top of the game on the pitch, naturally off the pitch, he's going to want to get to the very top.

"If he plays football like we did against North Macedonia [who Wales beat 7-1 in November] then any club out there that wants to play good football and wants a brilliant young coach, I'd be surprised if he's not on their radar."

Celtic job 'not on my radar' - Wales boss Bellamy

Euro 2028 bid a 'massive' motivation for Bellamy

title: Prep talk: Will Bryson III is averaging 33.1 points for St. Paul while showing leadership
description: Will Bryson III had a 68-point performance last month for St. Paul, and the 6-foot-4 guard is averaging 33.1 points a game.
fullText:
Will Bryson III of St. Paul stuck it out for his senior basketball season even though the team lost pretty much everybody to graduation except for him.

All he can do is his best, and that's what he has been doing, including a 68-point performance two weeks ago in Las Vegas in a triple overtime game.

Real Run Winter Classic has some terrific basketball games next weekend. pic.twitter.com/6c4DZm9hiD

‚Äî eric sondheimer (@latsondheimer) December 28, 2025

The 6-foot-4 guard is averaging 33.1 points a game for St. Paul (6-9) and showing dedication in that he stayed knowing the team might not be as good as last season's 19-11 team, but he'd be the leader entrusted to help young players develop. On Friday, he faces the state's leading scorer, Jason Crowe Jr. of Inglewood, in a noon game at Morningside. Crowe is averaging 43.9 points and the two have been facing off since their youth days.

68 Points, 11-11 FT‚Äôs, 9 Three Pointers, 12+ Rb‚Äôs in a triple OT win against a tough Larime HS. 3 Pointer to put us in OT. However, Our D won us the game.‚¨áÔ∏è 1, steal, foul, and 2 FT‚Äôs.@SGVNSports @latsondheimer @Tarek_Fattal @pollonpreps @RonMFlores @MaxPreps @247recruiting pic.twitter.com/y0rgaUTNh5

‚Äî Will Bryson III (@WillBrysonIII) December 31, 2025

Coach Patrick Roy has been raving about Bryson's contributions.

This is a daily look at the positive happenings in high school sports. To submit any news, please email eric.sondheimer@latimes.com.

title: New York Jets News: Jets‚Äô tank plans may have just gotten more complicated in Week 18
description: Your daily links to the New York Jets
fullText:
Good morning Gang Green Nation! The New York Jets will be on the road to face the Buffalo Bills in the last game of the regular season on Sunday. Josh Allen has not been practicing this week and is not expected to play on Sunday. For tank commanders that may cause some concern. Certainly the Jets‚Äô chances of an upset improve with Allen out. However, the Bills still have a substantial edge at quarterback with Mitchell Trubisky under center compared to the Jets with Brady Cook under center. Unless the Bills play all their third string players and practice squad call-ups, they should still be handily favored at home. Even if that were to transpire, we should not underestimate how low this Jets team has sunk. An upset is always possible, but for now betting on the Jets to complete their tank on Sunday seems the safer bet.

title: Friday Bird Droppings: The Orioles didn‚Äôt get Imai
description: The Japanese righty signed with the Astros, taking another SP candidate off the board for the Birds.
fullText:
In the Orioles‚Äô pursuit of a big-name starting pitcher, one major candidate just came off the board. Nippon Professional Baseball standout Tatsuya Imai reportedly will sign with the Houston Astros on a three-year, $54 million contract that includes opt-outs after every season.

It‚Äôs one of the most surprising free agent deals of the offseason, not only because it‚Äôs the Astros ‚Äî a team that has little history in the Japanese market, with only one previous signing from the country ‚Äî but also because Imai ended up with a contract worth a fraction of what some analysts predicted. The Athletic projected that the right-hander would land an eight-year, $190 million deal, while MLB Trade Rumors pegged him for six years and $150 million. But the 27-year-old ‚Äî whose posting period was set to expire today ‚Äî apparently didn‚Äôt get the offers he‚Äôd hoped for. Now he‚Äôll hope to prove himself in his debut season in the U.S. and perhaps opt out and cash in a bigger payday next winter.

My first thought is that the Orioles easily could have topped the Astros‚Äô offer if they wanted to. But so could a lot of other teams. And the fact that nobody did so (as far as we know) indicates that MLB front offices just aren‚Äôt sold on Imai‚Äôs chances of transferring his NPB success to the majors. Imai can hit 99 mph on his fastball but has faced some concerns about his secondary pitches and his control, with some scouts seeing him as more of a back-end starter type rather than an ace.

The Athletic‚Äôs Keith Law is one of the low guys on the totem pole on Imai, ranking him only 31st on his top 50 free agent list, behind such starting pitchers as Zac Gallen, Justin Verlander, and Chris Bassitt ‚Äî and Zach Eflin, whom the O‚Äôs have already re-signed. Law writes that Imai is ‚Äúprobably a mid-rotation starter‚Äù who has ‚Äúthe downside of a guy who‚Äôs going to allow too much hard contact on the heater to stay a starter.‚Äù

So, yes, there are some risks with Imai. But I would‚Äôve been happy to overlook those risks if the Orioles had been the ones to sign him. It would‚Äôve been the Birds‚Äô boldest excursion into the Far East market yet, and certainly would‚Äôve boosted the depth of the rotation, even if Imai isn‚Äôt a #1 or #2 type of starter. The O‚Äôs, though, seem to have decided that Imai wasn‚Äôt the right pitcher to target, or maybe he wasn‚Äôt interested in coming to Baltimore.

The Orioles will need to look elsewhere for a rotation upgrade. The Astros‚Äô signing of Imai could close the book on their chances of re-signing their longtime ace Framber Valdez, and perhaps the O‚Äôs are an intriguing fit for him, especially considering Mike Elias‚Äôs previous ties to Valdez during his Houston tenure. Ranger Su√°rez remains on the market, as do some of the mid-tier guys like Gallen and Bassitt.

It just feels like the O‚Äôs are still one arm away from a complete offseason. And now we know that arm won‚Äôt be Imai‚Äôs.

Orioles free agent targets: Comparing Framber Valdez vs. Ranger Su√°rez ‚Äì The Baltimore Sun

Matt Weyrich gives the tale of tape between Valdez and Su√°rez. Ah, I can‚Äôt decide. Might as well just sign them both.

Should Orioles bring back Danny Coulombe? | MAILBAG ‚Äì BaltimoreBaseball.com

The Orioles‚Äô bizarre decision to decline Coulombe‚Äôs option was one of their many blunders last offseason. I‚Äôd be happy to bring him back, but the O‚Äôs seem to have decided they‚Äôre not interested for whatever reason.

Starting the New Year on an optimistic note ‚Äì Steve Melewski

Melewski offers some reasons to be excited already about the 2026 Orioles. I‚Äôll admit the team does look good on paper, but I‚Äôm still too scarred by 2025 to dare to be truly optimistic.

1 prediction for every club in ‚Äô26 ‚Äì MLB.com

Orioles beat writer Jake Rill predicts the O‚Äôs will return to the postseason this year. It‚Äôs Optimism City in Birdland these days, apparently.

Is today your birthday? Happy birthday! And happy 28th birthday to Kyle Stowers, whom the O‚Äôs dealt in the Trevor Rogers trade in 2024. In his first season with everyday playing time, Stowers broke out as an NL All-Star for the Marlins last year, hitting 25 homers and OPS‚Äôing .912 in 117 games. Congrats to Kyle on his success, and considering the season that Rogers just had for the Orioles, I‚Äôd say that trade has worked out well for both sides.

Other ex-Orioles born on Jan. 2 include two right-handers named Garrett ‚Äî Reed Garrett (33) and Maryland native Garrett Stephenson (54) ‚Äî and outfielder Royle Stillman (75).

On this date in 2019, the Orioles hired Koby Perez as their senior director of international scouting, their first hire for that position under new general manager Mike Elias. Seven years later, Perez now has the title of vice president of international scouting and operations, and has helped the O‚Äôs set up an international talent pipeline that developed Samuel Basallo, among others.

title: 5 things to watch in the Chicago Bears-Detroit Lions game at Soldier Field ‚Äî plus our Week 18 predictions
description: The marathon is over. Sunday marks the end of the NFL regular season. In recent years, Week 18 has signaled the end for the Chicago Bears. Not so this year. For the first time since 2020, the Bears are headed to the postseason.
fullText:
The marathon is over. Sunday marks the end of the NFL regular season.

In recent years, Week 18 has signaled the end for the Chicago Bears. Not so this year. For the first time since 2020, the Bears are headed to the postseason. They have bigger goals on the horizon, starting with next week‚Äôs wild-card round of the playoffs.

But first, they have a matchup with the Detroit Lions. Sunday‚Äôs game has playoff implications. The simplest result is this: Win Sunday and they lock up the No. 2 seed in the NFC and a matchup with the No. 7 Green Bay Packers. A loss complicates matters a little, but the Bears are at least guaranteed a home game as NFC North champions.

Bears coach Ben Johnson already has declared his team is ‚Äúplaying to win.‚Äù Lions coach Dan Campbell said his squad will be competing, despite the fact they have nothing left to play for.

The Bears (11-5) square off against the Lions (8-8) on Sunday at Soldier Field (3:25 p.m., Fox-32). Here are five things to watch ahead of Week 18 ‚Äî plus the Tribune‚Äôs predictions for the game.

The NFL season is a brutal, physical journey from the time training camp starts in July until the playoffs in January.

‚ÄúThis is a race,‚Äù Johnson said on the day training camp began in July. The Bears are nearly at the end of the race now, and it has been a marathon more than a sprint.

Just think about where the Bears and the Lions were nearly four months ago. In Week 2, the Lions cruised to a 52-21 win over the Bears at Ford Field. The Bears fell to 0-2, while the Lions looked like the team that won 15 games a year ago.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs early in the season and you‚Äôre still getting to know your team a little bit,‚Äù Johnson said this week as he reflected on that game. ‚ÄúBeing in that locker room after that game and how that felt ‚Äî you don‚Äôt always remember exactly what was said or anything like that, but you always remember how you felt in those moments.‚Äù

Much has changed in the 15 weeks since then. The Bears are gearing up for a playoff run, and the Lions will be watching the postseason from home. Things change rapidly in the NFL. After that loss in Detroit, the Bears won their next four games and nine of 10.

The Lions, on the other hand, started the season 7-4 and in a favorable position before losing four of the next five. A Christmas Day loss in Minnesota eliminated the Lions from postseason contention.

Campbell suggested the Lions will play their starters, but he left some gray area with regard to players battling injury, which includes top receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown and tackle Penei Sewell.

‚ÄúI think if it‚Äôs ‚Äî we‚Äôre sitting there borderline, and the player, it could be hard (to play) or we think they‚Äôre setting themselves up for a long-term risk, then no, it‚Äôs not worth it,‚Äù Campbell told members of the Detroit media.

Williams needs 109 passing yards to break the Bears‚Äô single-season record. Erik Kramer set the mark with 3,838 yards in 1995. Jay Cutler came close to topping it with 3,812 yards in 2014, but the record has stood for 30 years.

Chicago Bears QB Caleb Williams on 4,000 yards: ‚ÄòI was brought here for those types of things‚Äô

Williams has surpassed 109 passing yards in every game this season. Also in play is a 4,000-yard season, something no Bears quarterback has done. Ever. With 3,730 yards this season, Williams needs 270 to reach the milestone.

The primary goal remains to win the game. But Williams said this week that he believes he‚Äôs in Chicago to rewrite the record books at the quarterback position.

‚ÄúIn 100 or however many years, it has never been done,‚Äù Williams said. ‚ÄúSo it symbolizes something.‚Äù

Williams has played some of his best football over the last three games. In wins against the Cleveland Browns and Packers and a road loss to the San Francisco 49ers, he has averaged 274 passing yards with six touchdown passes and zero interceptions.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm playing better than I have,‚Äù Williams said. ‚ÄúThese last three games, but even going back to some of the other games, some of the stats may not show it, but I feel that I‚Äôm playing better. I said it‚Äôs going to start showing here soon, and that‚Äôs a small sample of that. I‚Äôve got to keep growing, keep getting better.‚Äù

About that Week 2 beatdown in Detroit ‚Ä¶

That‚Äôs exactly the type of game that the old Bears would‚Äôve let bleed into the next week. A year ago, this same franchise lost on a brutal Hail Mary at Washington and went on to lose 10 consecutive games. Losing became inevitable.

While the early-season loss in Detroit might have felt like a ‚Äúhere we go again‚Äù moment, Johnson has never let his team think too much about any one game.

‚ÄúThat can kind of go one or two ways after that, right?‚Äù linebacker T.J. Edwards said. ‚ÄúAnd I think that shows where we‚Äôre at right now ‚Ä¶ having that belief in one another. It‚Äôs rare to have in a team where everyone is on the same page and everyone is understanding what we‚Äôre trying to get done. When those things are going wrong, it allows us to come together and make sure that it doesn‚Äôt stay that way.‚Äù

Column: Chicago Bears are ‚Äòmoving on to Detroit‚Äô ‚Äî but they won‚Äôt go far in playoffs if defense doesn‚Äôt improve

It‚Äôs a pertinent message this week, when the Bears are looking to brush off Sunday night‚Äôs loss in San Francisco. The Bears have built all sorts of momentum this season. They‚Äôve been, all things considered, relatively healthy. Although the defense struggled against the 49ers, the team has played well overall during the toughest part of the schedule down the stretch.

‚ÄúIt kind of just goes with Ben‚Äôs messaging every week,‚Äù Edwards said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been the same. He‚Äôs been consistent. So it‚Äôs easy for us to kind of follow. But it‚Äôs a week-to-week league, right? So after big wins, celebrate for a second and then you‚Äôve got to get back to work, and after big losses it‚Äôs no different because there‚Äôs another one coming up.‚Äù

The Bears want to head into the postseason on a positive note. A win against the Lions would do that.

The Philadelphia Eagles and Washington Commanders will also kick off at 3:25 p.m. If the Bears lose Sunday and the Eagles win, the Eagles would jump the Bears for the No. 2 seed, dropping the Bears to No. 3.

The No. 2 seed will play the Packers, who are locked in at No. 7. The No. 3 seed will play someone from the NFC West, either the 49ers or Los Angeles Rams.

The Bears probably would rather take their chances against the Packers, a team they‚Äôve played close twice already, winning once in dramatic fashion. The No. 2 seed also would play at home in the divisional round if it wins its first playoff game.

Reports out of Philadelphia have suggested the Eagles might sit their starters Sunday. That will be a situation to monitor. The Commanders, though, could start third-string quarterback Josh Johnson, so anything could happen even if the Eagles rest up for the playoffs.

Johnson has said the Bears are playing to win, but might that change if the Eagles are down by two touchdowns at halftime?

Odunze has missed four games with a foot injury. The Bears receiver hasn‚Äôt played since Nov. 28 in Philadelphia. Odunze has not participated in practice this week.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see how this week goes,‚Äù Johnson said when asked about Odunze.

Rookie receiver Luther Burden III suffered a quad injury on the last play against the 49ers but has been back on the practice field this week. That‚Äôs a good sign for the Bears.

In Detroit, a number of key starters have been on the injury report, including linebacker Alex Anzalone (concussion), defensive tackle Alim McNeill (abdomen), Sewell (ankle), St. Brown (knee/ankle) and left tackle Taylor Decker (shoulder/illness).

Both teams will release one more injury report Friday.

The Bears are looking to tighten things up defensively after a woeful showing in San Francisco and along come the Lions, who have some key injury concerns on offense involving wide receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown and left tackle Taylor Decker, among others. Injuries also have rocked the Lions secondary, and opposing quarterbacks, with the exception of Minnesota Vikings undrafted rookie Max Brosmer last week, have lit up the Lions of late. The Bears have plenty of motivation with the No. 2 seed in the NFC there for the taking, even with reports that the Eagles, also in contention for that seed, are expected to rest key players for their finale against the Commanders.

Week 18 is weird. But I‚Äôm going to take Johnson‚Äôs word when he says the Bears are playing to win. I‚Äôm not convinced the Lions truly are, no matter what they say. They have nothing to play for. Beyond Week 18 weirdness, though, the Bears have shown in the second half of the season that they‚Äôre the better team. I think they cap off a remarkable turnaround with win No. 12.

The Lions are fizzling to a disappointing finish. The Bears have several incentives in this rematch: Secure the No. 2 seed, redeem the loss of a winnable game against the 49ers and avenge Week 2‚Äôs blowout loss in which the Lions ran up the score (don‚Äôt let anyone convince you otherwise). The Bears need to sharpen all phases heading into the playoffs, and the injury-riddled Lions look like sacrificial lambs.

title: Dolphins predicted to replace Tua Tagovailoa with $180 million Pro Bowl quarterback
description: The Dolphins could make a big splash with a quarterback signing.
fullText:
Dolphins predicted to replace Tua Tagovailoa with $180 million Pro Bowl quarterback originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Miami Dolphins will wrap up their 2025 season on Sunday when they take on the New England Patriots in Week 18. Miami has had quite the eventful season for more bad reasons than good, which sets up a very interesting offseason for Miami.

The Dolphins fired general manager Chris Grier in the middle of the season, and head coach Mike McDaniel benched Tua Tagovailoa after the team's Week 15 loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers, which all but ends his tenure in Miami. If that is the case, Miami will need a new starter at quarterback, which they could address in the NFL Draft or with a signing/trade. Kristopher Knox of Bleacher Report weighs in on the matter and says Kirk Cousins to Miami would make sense.

"Regardless of McDaniels' fate, it feels like Miami is out on Tua Tagovailoa, who was benched for Ewers for performance reasons," Knox writes. "Offloading Tagovailoa's contract this coming offseason won't be easy, as it will contain¬†$56.4 million¬†in dead money, but if the Dolphins can do it, they may need a veteran QB to at least push Ewers. Cousins could do exactly that, and he could feel good enough about his chances of beating out the Texas product that he'd sign off on a trade to South Beach. It's also worth noting that McDaniel was on the Washington Commanders' staff during Cousins' first two seasons in the NFL."

Cousins has started seven games in 2025 after Michael Penix went down with a torn ACL. The four-time Pro Bowler was signed by Atlanta in 2024 to a $180 million deal and was benched at the tail end of the 2024 season. If given the right offense, we've seen what Cousins is capable of. With Jaylen Waddle and De'Von Achane as proven commodities, Miami could do a lot worse than signing Cousins once he is released, which is heavily expected.

title: Kings‚Äô Doug Christie finds silver lining from loss to Celtics
description: Doug Christie is at least seeing signs of life from the moribund Kings despite suffering their third consecutive defeat.
fullText:
Kings‚Äô Doug Christie finds silver lining from loss to Celtics appeared first on ClutchPoints. 

The Sacramento Kings may have the bleakest outlook of any team in the NBA; even their peers at the bottom of the standings have slivers of hope to hold on to. Meanwhile, the Kings have a roster that doesn‚Äôt make sense all while having logjams at nearly every position and having injury problems afflicting a few of their key players. To start off the new calendar year, Sacramento lost once more, suffering their third consecutive defeat in a 120-106 loss to the Boston Celtics.

Try as the Kings might, this roster is simply a hodgepodge that they have to move on from to truly begin their rebuild. Even some of the decisions that head coach Doug Christie has been making have been head-scratching, such as de-prioritizing Keon Ellis and Nique Clifford as well as relegating big-money free-agent signing Dennis Schroder to a bench role.

But if it‚Äôs any consolation, the Kings head coach is recognizing better effort from his team as they look towards starting off 2026 on a better note than they did on Thursday.

‚ÄúThe compete level and the standard that we‚Äôre looking for was much, much better,‚Äù Christie said, per Brenden Nunes of Sactown Sports 1140.

There is going to be not much rest for these weary Kings as they face the Phoenix Suns on the road later tonight at 9:00 PM E.T.

The Kings are in a bit of a transition period at the moment, but it‚Äôs clear that eventually, they will have to blow up this roster. They‚Äôre going to have to embrace the youth movement at some point and perhaps build around Domantas Sabonis, the star they chose to keep instead of De‚ÄôAaron Fox.

It will be up to the Kings‚Äô ownership, however, if they will permit the team‚Äôs need to start over. But for the team‚Äôs sake, they will have to do so.

title: Nets‚Äô Jordi Fernandez calls for Cam Thomas to do more outside of scoring
description: Jordi Fernandez is asking Nets guard Cam Thomas to do what everyone else has been asking him to his entire career.
fullText:
Nets‚Äô Jordi Fernandez calls for Cam Thomas to do more outside of scoring appeared first on ClutchPoints. 

The Brooklyn Nets were down a few key guys on New Year‚Äôs Day, so it wasn‚Äôt a surprise to see them suffer a blowout defeat to the Houston Rockets, a 120-96 loss to begin the new calendar year. Their starting lineup sans Michael Porter Jr. just couldn‚Äôt get anything going on offense, which should not have come as a surprise to anyone as well considering that Cam Thomas was left on the bench to start off proceedings.

Thomas, in his 23 minutes off the bench, still ended up leading the team in scoring with 21 on 8-13 shooting. He is clearly the best shot creator on the Nets roster, and the 24-year-old guard doesn‚Äôt seem to be relishing his reduced role on the team. But the Nets‚Äô demands of him are crystal clear; head coach Jordi Fernandez simply wants Thomas to be a more impactful overall player instead of just filling up one column of the box score.

‚ÄúGood scoring punch with the minutes that he‚Äôs playing‚Ä¶ Obviously, his superpower is his scoring, but once again, I need better defense, I need better playmaking,‚Äù Fernandez said of Thomas in his postgame presser, via ClutchPoints Nets beat reporter Erik Slater.

Jordi Fernandez on Cam Thomas' performance tonight:

‚ÄúGood scoring punch with the minutes that he‚Äôs playing‚Ä¶ Obviously, his superpower is his scoring, but once again, I need better defense, I need better playmaking.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/OAeW5wXY1z

‚Äî Erik Slater (@erikslater_) January 2, 2026

For all of the demands anyone can ask of Thomas, it may just be easier to accept that this is the kind of player he is: a microwave scorer who can provide instant offense for a team that needs some scoring help. Thomas certainly has the makings of someone who can be a winning player, but the Nets aren‚Äôt exactly willing to give it time to see whether or not he can be part of the next winning team in Brooklyn.

And with Thomas refusing to commit his future to the Nets franchise, instead choosing to accept the qualifying offer which has him on course to enter unrestricted free agency at year‚Äôs end, Brooklyn has no reason to prioritize him anyway.

title: Should Romero have been sent off against Brentford?
description: Should Tottenham's Cristian Romero have been sent off for bringing down Brentford's Igor Thiago when the striker was through on goal?
fullText:
Keith Andrews was far from happy after Tottenham defender Cristian Romero escaped a red card in the 0-0 draw on New Year's Day.

The Brentford manager was adamant Romero should have been sent off for bringing down Igor Thiago when the striker was running through on goal.

Romero did not even concede a free-kick let alone be shown a card.

Andrew said in his post-match news conference that it was "a blatant red card" because "Thiago was stopped from getting to the ball".

You can see Andrews' point. Romero made a wild swing at the ball to try to intercept a pass. In doing so, Thiago was brought down.

When play has continued the video assistant referee (VAR), Alex Chilowicz, has two things to consider. Firstly, was the foul itself a clear and obvious error and then was it definitely a denial of an obvious goal-scoring opportunity (DOGSO).

The VAR cannot intervene purely on the free-kick, it has to be both a foul and a red card.

Romero brought his left leg across the Brentford player, creating a barrier and halting his progress.

It is hard to argue against a foul so why did the on-field officials not give it?

From their perspective it could have looked like Romero hooked the ball because he came away in possession. But this was a result of momentum rather than an executed challenge.

That leaves the VAR to consider DOGSO.

When assessing DOGSO referees are told to imagine the scenario without the defender at the point of the foul.

The ball was in front of Thiago, there was no other defender in close proximity and play was a few yards outside the area.

Thiago would surely have collected the ball, run forward a few yards and taken a shot.

That Romero came away with the ball has probably given the VAR some doubts that Thiago would take control. It gave the perception that play would not have continued forward.

However, this happens after the foul and the ball only stopped because Romero landed on it. A DOGSO red card appears to be the more logical outcome.

While the ball did touch Romero's arm it was accidental and would not be considered handball.

It could have been Romero's third red card in under a month.

Andrews was annoyed that Romero was not sent off when the two teams met on 6 December. Again the Argentine defender had made a challenge on Thiago.

It was a scissors-style tackle which Andrews felt was a "very easy one" for the officials.

The Premier League's Key Match Incidents Panel voted 3-2 that Romero should have been sent off by referee Rob Jones. But it was a 4-1 vote that the VAR, Tim Wood, was right not to intervene and advise a red card.

Romero was sent off for two yellow cards against Liverpool on 20 December.

On one side of the argument is that players go to ground too easily trying to get decisions. The other is that if you do not go down you won't get a foul.

Hugo Ekitike broke through into the area under pressure from Leeds defender Jaka Bijol in New Year's Day's 0-0 draw.

Bijol had arms around the Liverpool striker, who stayed on his feet and tried to get a shot away. Ekitike was crowded out and did not manage a shot.

"I don't think it's a surprise to anyone that one of my players stay on their feet," Liverpool boss Arne Slot said.

"It's just a team who we are and unfortunately it's not recognised. The questions is, should we change or not? I don't think we should.

"If he goes down it probably would have been a red card and a penalty and that would have increased our chances of winning."

Bijol was saved from a VAR review because he was not holding the Germany international in a conventional sense. That means by tugging the shirt or dragging the opponent back.

A VAR, in this case Darren England, always has to assess impact. That is far more difficult if a player does not go down. So by its very nature a player who stays up is less likely to get a decision.

If Ekitike had gone down, proving that he had been impacted, it may well have been a penalty and a red card for DOGSO.

title: Real Madrid set to closely scout midfield target in the second half of the season
description: According to a report from AS, Real Madrid scouts will closely monitor Kees Smit over the next six months before the 2026 FIFA World Cup.¬†It is known that the AZ Alkmaar youngster is being followed a...
fullText:
According to a report from AS, Real Madrid scouts will closely monitor Kees Smit over the next six months before the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

It is known that the AZ Alkmaar youngster is being followed as part of Madrid‚Äôs wider plan to identify a midfield orchestrator capable of leading the team into the next cycle.

As mentioned many times in the past, Real Madrid are preparing to reinforce their midfield in the summer of 2026.

With that objective in mind, Smit has emerged as a profile that fits many of the club‚Äôs requirements.

Over recent weeks, his name has gathered serious traction among scouts, not just in Spain but across Europe.

Competition for Smit‚Äôs signature is expected to be fierce.

Several top clubs are aware of his rapid development, but Real Madrid believe their sporting project and global pull could be decisive if they choose to make a concrete move.

The club see him as a player who is young enough to grow, yet already mature enough to handle responsibility at the highest level.

Real Madrid will keep an eye on Kees Smit. (Photo by Richard Pelham/Getty Images)

At just 19 years old, Smit has already taken important steps forward in his career. He has made his debut for the Dutch national team under Ronald Koeman, who is counting on him as part of his plans heading into the World Cup.

Koeman‚Äôs faith has been telling, and comparisons to Pedri only underline the type of midfielder Smit is becoming.

Meanwhile, Real Madrid‚Äôs interest is not new. Club scouts were first drawn to Smit during a Youth League match in the 2022‚Äì23 season, when AZ Alkmaar convincingly defeated Real Madrid 4-0.

That performance sparked sustained monitoring of his progress, and since then, his development has only reinforced the initial impressions.

From now until the end of the season, the evaluation process will intensify. Madrid intend to observe him continuously, analysing not only his performances but also his consistency, personality, and response to pressure.

However, under contract until 2028, AZ Alkmaar currently value him at around ‚Ç¨60 million.

It is already a hefty figure for a player who turns 20 on January 21, but one that could climb even higher with strong international exposure.

title: Broncos set to go six straight seasons without a 1,000-yard rusher
description: The Broncos have not had a 1,000-yard rusher since Phillip Lindsay totaled 1,011 yards in 2019.
fullText:
Barring a 488-yard performance from RJ Harvey on Sunday, the Denver Broncos are on the verge of a sixth-straight season without a 1,000-yard rusher, the third-longest active streak in the NFL.

Harvey has 863 yards from scrimmage and 12 total touchdowns this season, but his rushing total stands at 512 yards. Going up against L.A.'s top-ten run defense, Harvey is unlikely to hit 1,000 rushing yards as a rookie.

J.K. Dobbins was well on his way to 1,000 with 772 yards through 10 games until he suffered a foot injury. Before that injury, Dobbins was on pace for a 1,312-yard season in 2025.

Denver's leading rushers over the past six years were Dobbins (772), Javonte Williams (513), Williams (774), Latavius Murray (703), Melvin Gordon (918) and Gordon (986). The team's last 1,000-yard rusher was Phillip Lindsay, who totaled 1,011 yards on the ground in 2019.

Dobbins is currently scheduled to become a free agent in 2026. If he re-signs, Dobbins would get an opportunity to hit 1,000 yards next season. Otherwise, Harvey would be in line to take over RB1 duties.

title: Auburn football WR Eric Singleton declares for the NFL Draft
description: Eric Singleton will test the NFL draft waters after spending one season at Auburn.
fullText:
Auburn football wide receiver Eric Singleton has punched his ticket to the 2026 NFL Draft. His announcement came via his social media.

A massive transfer from Georgia Tech for the Tigers a year ago, Singleton played a total of three seasons in his collegiate. He spent two seasons with the Yellow Jackets recording over 700 yards in both seasons. This year with the Tigers he finished with 534 yards receiving on 57 receptions and three touchdowns. Singleton career totals were 2,002 yards receiving on 162 receptions and 12 receiving touchdowns.

Hugh Freeze's offense never seemed to fully unlock Singleton's potential at Auburn. The junior wide receiver had his lowest receiving and total yards at Auburn. Singleton did see a uptick after the Freeze firing and offensive coordinator Derrick Nix took over play calling. Against Vanderbilt, he hauled in 11 passes for 102 yards and a touchdown

Preseason CBS Sports ranked him a top-10 receiver in the 2026 draft. Singleton's draft stock could rise in the coming months at the NFL Combine with a chance to showcase his speed and route running ability.

title: Oregon Ducks open as underdogs against Indiana in CFP Semifinals
description: Bettors see the Oregon Ducks as slight underdogs against the Indiana Hoosiers in the College Football Playoff Semifinals.
fullText:
There are only a few more games before the college football season ends, and one of them will feature the Oregon Ducks. They advanced to the College Football Playoff Semifinals today and will take on a team they‚Äôve already lost to this season, the Indiana Hoosiers.

Both of these teams won their games in convincing fashion and when they met earlier in the season, the Ducks lost by 10 points in a game that was closer than the final score indicated. Much like the Texas Tech Red Raiders, who Oregon just mopped the floor with, the Ducks and the Hoosiers have a ton of similarities that lead you to believe it will be a tightly-contested game.

This is reflected in the betting odds for the game, with FanDuel Sportsbook currently setting the spread at plus-3 1/2 for the Ducks, just their second time being an underdog this season. The moneyline odds opened up at plus-158 for Oregon and minus-192 for Indiana, with the point total set at 47 1/2.

One of the best games we‚Äôve seen this season was the Ducks and the Hoosiers, and now they will meet again in the playoffs as arguably the two best teams in the nation, regardless of seeding. These lines are sure to move between now and next Friday, but for now, bettors are expecting this to be close, low-scoring game.

title: Texas A&M has two more intriguing transfer wide receivers to consider
description: Texas A&M needs an X receiver, and two more intriguing options have entered the transfer portal, including Texas WR Parker Livingstone.
fullText:
The transfer portal is open, and Texas A&M head coach Mike Elko will have plenty to consider on both sides of the ball, which will include adding another wide receiver after KC Concepcion announced his intention to enter the 2026 NFL Draft, a decision that was not surprising given his elite performance during the 2025 season.

While Concepcion's playmaking ability will be missed, the Aggies need to find a true X receiver with the height, length, and catch radius to shore up the red zone offense, allowing starting quarterback Marcel Reed to continue improving as a pocket passer, and provide more confidence with another playmaker to utilize through the air.

This week, the news that Auburn star wide receiver Cam Coleman planned to enter the transfer portal was shocking to say the least. While the Aggies have been directly connected to the standout pass catcher, several intriguing names have entered the portal, including Texas wide receiver Parker Livingstone and Rutgers wideout Ian Strong, who both fit that X receiver mold.

Livingstone's departure was surprising after finishing his redshirt freshman season with 516 yards and six receiving touchdowns. At the same time, his close friendship with starting quarterback Arch Manning helped create one of the better connections. Does this mean the Longhorns are freeing up space to pursue Cam Coleman? Possibly, but nothing has been reported.

Ian Strong is another solid option, standing at 6'3", and totaled 95 receptions for 1,438 yards and 10 touchdowns during his last two seasons at Rutgers. Aggie fans will remember wide receiver Caleb Chapman, who, despite his injury issues, was one of the more reliable deep threats because of his stature and long-strider speed, which has been missing from the A&M passing attack since Noah Thomas transferred to Georgia.

Contact/Follow us¬†@AggiesWire¬†on X¬†(formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions.¬†Follow Cameron on X:¬†@CameronOhnysty.

This article originally appeared on Aggies Wire: Texas A&M has two more intriguing transfer wide receivers to consider

title: Chiefs OC Matt Nagy evaluates offense heading into the season finale
description: During Thursday's press conference, Kansas City Chiefs coordinator Matt Nagy evaluated the offense heading into the season finale | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
Kansas City Chiefs offensive coordinator Matt Nagy spoke with reporters during his recent press conference, discussing the expectations for the offense heading into Week 18 and looking ahead to next season.

"The biggest thing for us that we've been really focusing on, and this is not just offense but as a team, is win. Do everything we can to win," said Nagy, "As an offense, our part of it is making sure that we understand that this part of the season, going into the final game, it's been a while since we've been in this territory, mentally as you go through the week of the prep stuff and then different players in different positions playing, that sort of thing. So, no matter who it is, the one common denominator is we have the same schedule throughout the week, with the practices, the same mindset for us of going in and trying to do everything we can to play well and win."

The Chiefs' offense has struggled with consistency and big plays all season, even when Patrick Mahomes was healthy. Nagy believes in the team's future as he tries to piece together what went wrong in 2025.

"Big picture offensively for us is I think all of us understanding that the season didn't go as we wanted to in the end. There were parts of the year in the middle of the season where we felt like ‚Äì and I think I brought this up to you before, we really felt like we were at a peak level offensively," said Nagy, "Unfortunately, it didn't last all the way through the year. Now here we are at the end of the year playing in this game that is important to us to finish strong, and it's our job to do that, to coach strong players to play strong, and then in the end, win. I think the last several games didn't go how we wanted, but we want to finish on a high note."

Kansas City's lone touchdown in Week 17 was led by quarterback Chris Oladokun, who completed 13-of-22 passes for 66 yards and a touchdown. He connected with running back Brashard Smith for a 5-yard score early in the second quarter.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Chiefs OC Matt Nagy evaluates offense heading into the season finale

title: Notre Dame loses former 4-star prospect to the transfer portal
description: Notre Dame football continued to see more players from the current roster enter the portal, as defensive lineman Armel Mukam will leave the Irish.
fullText:
Notre Dame football took another hit to its roster on Thursday evening, as a defensive lineman has opted to enter the portal over staying in South Bend according to CBS Sports‚Äô Matt Zenitz.

Armel Mukam entered the program as a 4-star prospect out of Virginia, but really wasn‚Äôt able to make a mark in the three years that he saw the field for the Irish. He‚Äôll end his career with 11 tackles and a forced fumble.

Mukam saw the field plenty this fall, and does have plenty of potential to be a difference maker, but it won‚Äôt happen with Notre Dame. As a redshirt sophomore, he‚Äôll have two more seasons of eligibility.

As a native of Canada, Mukam could end up almost anywhere, as he looks for a bigger role. We wish Armel the best as the continues his football journey away from the Irish.

Notre Dame defensive lineman Armel Mukam is entering the transfer portal, his agent @AJ_Calabro tells @CBSSports.

Mukam, a Class of 2023 top-200 overall recruit, played in all 12 games this year for Notre Dame. pic.twitter.com/2kJtr93V1e

‚Äî Matt Zenitz (@mzenitz) January 1, 2026

Contact/Follow us¬†@IrishWireND¬†on X (Formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Notre Dame news, notes, and opinions.

title: Can Commanders LB Jordan Magee replace Bobby Wagner in 2026?
description: Can Jordan Magee replace Bobby Wagner in the middle of the Commanders' defense in 2026? That's a key offseason question.
fullText:
The Washington Commanders have plenty of holes to fill this upcoming offseason. While Washington needs to add another starting receiver, perhaps a tight end, and a running back, the Commanders have their quarterback and an offensive line to build around.

It's another story on defense. Washington needs plenty of help. Fortunately, the Commanders have the cap space to be active in free agency and a top-seven pick in the 2026 NFL draft to help improve the defense.

One question GM Adam Peters and head coach Dan Quinn must resolve before the offseason begins is how many young defenders can step into a starting role next season? One name comes to mind: linebacker Jordan Magee.

The second-year linebacker from Temple has seen increased snaps on defense this season. Magee has played in every game for Washington this season, making seven starts. With the Commanders using Frankie Luvu more as a pass rusher, Magee has played alongside Bobby Wagner at linebacker. Magee has flashed numerous times in 2025, as his speed is something Washington lacks on defense.

When the Commanders selected Magee in the 2024 NFL draft, they reportedly liked him as the heir apparent to the future Hall of Famer Wagner. Unfortunately, Magee hasn't had any snaps at Mike linebacker to see if he could handle that role full-time in 2026.

Head coach Dan Quinn was asked about Magee is ready for that responsibility.

The part that you want to do is like, how do you train somebody into that space?" Quinn said this week. "And some of it is, in practice, you have a number of them that can have it on, so they're hearing my communication. So, what we would never want is on the first time you heard it, like, 'Oh, that's what Dan sounds like, or that's what it sounds like.' And so, you go through that process in the practice. So, when he takes his reps in the practice, when if he was with the second or the third group, it's the same exact process that I would do with Wags, 'Hey, this down in distance, remind this player alert for this.' So, there's a little bit of directing that comes of it."

With Washington long out of contention, fans have wanted to see Magee replace Wagner. That's not the right decision. Wagner remains one of the Commanders' top defensive players, despite his struggles in coverage. The ideal scenario would be limiting his snaps. It would not only help keep Wagner fresh, but also give the staff an evaluation of how Magee handles playing inside.

Quinn offered even more details on Magee playing inside.

"Think if you were a quarterback in the huddle and you want to give one more reminder before you broke out to somebody, you would tell them that that's sometimes what I'm telling that person to do into that spot and then going in, you want to find out did they do it in college and signals and now it'll be different I suppose because that's been an additional thing that they're doing that we haven't done before," he said. "But just the leading part of it, I think that's the big thing, the vocal part of it. Doesn't mean you have to be loud and rah rah, but you have to be somebody that can take command, that can give information quickly. And not all linebackers can do that."

That's a thorough answer. Was Quinn telling us something about Magee without actually saying it? It's clear he likes him. The Commanders see Magee as a part of their future, but that doesn't necessarily mean playing inside.

Wagner is 35 and a free agent at season's end. With so many holes to fix on defense, don't count on the Commanders handing the position to Magee full-time in 2026 without knowing if he's ready for it. Whose fault is that?

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: Can Jordan Magee replace Bobby Wagner in 2026?

title: Sixers discuss defensive effort from guards after win over Mavericks
description: The Philadelphia 76ers discuss the defensive effort from the guards following their win over the Dallas Mavericks on Thursday.
fullText:
The Philadelphia 76ers were able to even up their road trip at 2-2 with a 123-108 win over the Dallas Mavericks on New Year's Day. The Sixers are now in position for a 3-2 road trip if they can finish it with a win over the New York Knicks at Madison Square Garden on Saturday.

One aspect from the win over the Mavericks that has to be pointed out is the defensive effort by Tyrese Maxey and VJ Edgecombe. While Edgecombe had the billing of being a defender entering the draft, it has been the opposite for Maxey as he has had to work hard to be a more than solid defender for Philadelphia at this stage.

Maxey had two blocks and two steals against the Mavericks while Edgecombe had four steals and a rude block in the fourth quarter to seal it for Philadelphia. After the win, coach Nick Nurse revealed he and his staff have been working with both to get some pick 6 type of opportunities on the defensive end.

"Again, those guys are both lightning quick, and we're trying to work on some things where they can create some turnovers or some pick six--those are huge," Nurse told reporters. "Even Q (Quentin Grimes) has such a burst into some passing lanes, and you get one or two of those a game that gives you a free layup at the other end."

The Sixers have to get creative with Maxey on the defensive end of the floor to make up for some limitations here and there. While credit has to go to Maxey for the constant work he has put in to become the defender he is right now, the Sixers have still needed to get creative with their backcourt pairing.

"We try¬†to be aggressive with¬†guys that are making spin moves and things like that," Nurse finished. "You see us chasing those guys down. We get hurt by it, sometimes a little over-aggressive, but for the most part, we created some turnovers, and that turned into some easy offense."

If Maxey and Edgecombe continue to take steps in the defensive department of their game, then that enhances what they can do on the offensive end. The two combined for 57 points while also causing problems for Dallas on the defensive end. That's something the Sixers will hope can continue to grow as time moves on.

This article originally appeared on Sixers Wire: Sixers discuss defensive effort from guards after win over Mavericks

title: Amorim looking ahead to ultimate footballing Roses clash
description: In the modern day, there is something special about the cricket battles between Yorkshire and Lancashire, but in a football sense, despite there being many sides from both counties, meetings between the teams from Elland Road and Old Trafford are standalones.  Leeds' stadium will be a cauldron on Sunday.  Amorim knows all about derby matches - he played for Benfica against Sporting and managed the other way round - but I suspect he will be told anyway about the reception he can expect from the moment Manchester United's team coach arrives at the ground.
fullText:
I am not sure if Ruben Amorim's knowledge of English history extends to the War of the Roses but if so, he will know it is the foundation of the rivalry between Leeds United and Manchester United.

In the modern day, there is something special about the cricket battles between Yorkshire and Lancashire, but in a football sense, despite there being many sides from both counties, meetings between the teams from Elland Road and Old Trafford are standalones.

Both clubs' supporters chant about the other, even when they are not in the same league.

Leeds' stadium will be a cauldron on Sunday.

Amorim knows all about derby matches - he played for Benfica against Sporting and managed the other way round - but I suspect he will be told anyway about the reception he can expect from the moment Manchester United's team coach arrives at the ground.

Manchester United's head coach will be looking ahead to the fixture at 13:30 GMT on Friday.

Come back to this page later on for all the key lines from Amorim.

title: Argentine Starlet Faces Fresh Setback As Inter Milan Consider His Future
description: Inter Milan are assessing the future of Tomas Palacios after the Argentine defender suffered another injury, with the club now open to a January exit.As confirmed by La Gazzetta dello Sport, Palacios ...
fullText:
Inter Milan are assessing the future of Tomas Palacios after the Argentine defender suffered another injury, with the club now open to a January exit.

As confirmed by La Gazzetta dello Sport, Palacios is currently sidelined and is expected to remain out for around 20 days. The setback complicates an already difficult time in Italy for the young defender, who has struggled to find continuity since arriving in Milan.

Inter are now actively considering a transfer during the winter window.

The Nerazzurri would prefer to resolve the situation quickly, especially given the limited opportunities Palacios has had to integrate into the first-team rotation.

However, the player‚Äôs stance does not fully align with the club‚Äôs intentions.

‚ÄúFor obvious reasons, there is a desire to sell him immediately,‚Äù La Gazzetta reports, ‚Äúbut at the same time Palacios is digging in his heels and wants to remain in Milan at least until the end of the season.‚Äù

That position could still change.

According to the newspaper, a return to his former club, Independiente Rivadavia, represents a possible solution if a concrete proposal arrives in the coming weeks.

For Inter, the priority is clarity.

title: Several Newcastle players closing in on returns

fullText:
Eddie Howe says Tino Livramento, Kieran Trippier, Sven Botman and Anthony Elanga are all closing in on returns from injury.

All four have been sidelined of late but Howe is hopeful of having all of them back shortly.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got a couple of training days but Tino and Kieran have worked really well,‚Äù Howe said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve had proper recovery periods so they are both close.

‚ÄúLewis Miley, I have said time and again how well he has done in a position he hasn‚Äôt played before, again against Burnley I thought he was magnificent for us but we‚Äôd love to get our full-backs back fit and available and boost the squad in terms of numbers.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been very thin on the ground for defenders so that will be a big area.‚Äù

Howe says Botman has also been back in training and could even return for the game against Crystal Palace.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre both very close. Sven‚Äôs been training with the group which has been great so I envisage that he will be in and around this game.

‚ÄúAnthony hasn‚Äôt trained with us yet but is very close to doing so.‚Äù

title: 'We need the fans' - Van Dijk understands frustrations
description: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has said understands fan frustrations, adding that he and his team-mates want to do "everything in our power" to win matches.  There were boos at full-time at Anfield after Liverpool drew 0-0 with Leeds United on Thursday.  In the second half, Arne Slot's side managed just one attempt on target as they attacked the Kop and that came from from outside the box.
fullText:
Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has said understands fan frustrations, adding that he and his team-mates want to do "everything in our power" to win matches.

There were boos at full-time at Anfield after Liverpool drew 0-0 with Leeds United on Thursday.

In the second half, Arne Slot's side managed just one attempt on target as they attacked the Kop and that came from from outside the box.

"This is definitely not an attack on the fans. The fans can feel how they feel, but we as players want to win games as well," said Van Dijk.

"We're not going out there to try to pass the ball from left to right and just keep the ball. We want to do everything in our power to win the game as well.

"I've been very fortunate to experience so many nights, afternoons and early kick-offs when the fans gave us an extra lift. Obviously, when you drop points against Leeds, that is frustrating, but we need the fans in order to keep pushing us forward.

"And I don't have any doubts that will be the case. We'll see them again in London with full support."

The Reds travel to the capital to take on Fulham on Sunday (15:00 GMT) and will be looking to extend their unbeaten run to nine games.

However, Slot's side short of ideas against Leeds, who set up in a 5-4-1 shape on Thursday. And Van Dijk admitted Liverpool should have been better in the final third.

"It's very easy to say [we should move the ball quicker] when you play against a team that plays with 5-4-1 or 5-3-2," said the centre-back. "Sometimes you have to drag them to one side and then speed up. But, like I said, the last part of our game wasn't good enough.

"I sensed the frustration, but also I think that frustration comes from the fact we dropped points and that's obviously something we didn't want."

Asked whether he felt Liverpool had lost something going forward with their recent change in system, Van Dijk replied: "I don't think there's a complete change of system.

"It feels more compact but there's a lot more emphasis on having to defend as a team in order to prevent chances against you. That's definitely been happening.

"You see the hard work our midfield has put in to help us as the last line."

Hear more from Van Dijk on BBC Sounds

title: From Spain: Total agreement Roma-Atletico for Raspadori
description: Giacomo Raspadori could be Roma‚Äôs first signing of the winter transfer window. Gian Piero Gasperini has been following him for several years and could now welcome him to the capital. Negotiations wi...
fullText:
Giacomo Raspadori could be Roma‚Äôs first signing of the winter transfer window.

Gian Piero Gasperini has been following him for several years and could now welcome him to the capital.

Negotiations with Atl√©tico Madrid, however, have been far from easy, with Roma always pushing for a loan with an option to buy.

The Spanish club pushed for the obligation to buy, but in the last few hours they have backtracked.

In fact, ‚ÄòJack‚Äô is expected to leave Spain under the terms imposed by Roma.

As reported by Sport, the deal is very close to being finalized, but the newspaper has revealed a behind-the-scenes story.

Diego Simeone, in fact, isn‚Äôt looking to permanently separate from Raspadori.

The connection between the player and the Argentine coach hasn‚Äôt blossomed this season, but ‚ÄòCholo‚Äô believes the Italian attacking midfielder is an important asset for the future.

The Colchoneros have therefore agreed to a loan with an option to buy, as per their coach‚Äôs wishes.

Despite the involvement of other clubs, Raspadori is expected to join the Giallorossi.

Gasp hopes to have him at least on the bench, either for the midweek match against Lecce on January 6th or the match against Sassuolo on the 10th.

After signing the Italian attacking midfielder, Roma will pounce on Joshua Zirkzee.

title: Lazio identify Sassuolo forward Pinamonti as Castellanos replacement
description: Lazio are already moving to reshape their attack following Valentin Castellanos‚Äô departure, with Andrea Pinamonti emerging as a leading candidate to fill the void.Castellanos‚Äô exit has now been fi...
fullText:
Lazio are already moving to reshape their attack following Valentin Castellanos‚Äô departure, with Andrea Pinamonti emerging as a leading candidate to fill the void.

Castellanos‚Äô exit has now been finalised, with the Argentine set to join West Ham United in a deal worth around ‚Ç¨30 million including bonuses.

The striker has signed a long-term contract running until 2030, bringing an end to a spell in Rome that had become increasingly strained under Maurizio Sarri. Castellanos opted to remain in Europe and test himself in the Premier League, turning down an alternative offer from Flamengo.

ROME, ITALY ‚Äì AUGUST 31: Valentin Castellanos of Lazio celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs third goal during the Serie A match between SS Lazio and Hellas Verona FC at Stadio Olimpico on August 31, 2025 in Rome, Italy. (Photo by Paolo Bruno/Getty Images)

With the sale essentially completed, Lazio‚Äôs focus has shifted immediately to reinforcements.

Sarri has made it clear that a new centre-forward is required, and according to Tuttosport, Andrea Pinamonti of Sassuolo is now one of the main profiles under consideration.

The trail leading to Giacomo Raspadori has cooled, with the Italy international now expected to head to Roma.

VERONA, ITALY ‚Äì OCTOBER 03: Andrea Pinamonti of Sassuolo celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs first goal during the Serie A match between Hellas Verona FC and US Sassuolo Calcio at Stadio Marcantonio Bentegodi on October 03, 2025 in Verona, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

Lazio‚Äôs January plans are not limited to the No.9 role. Sarri has also requested an attacking winger, with sporting director Angelo Fabiani continuing talks for Daniel Maldini. Meanwhile, the coach‚Äôs preferred option remains Lorenzo Insigne, who has already given his approval to a short-term deal with an option through 2027 and is waiting for a call from Formello.

Further changes could follow. Nuno Tavares is edging toward an exit, with Al Ittihad his likely destination. Should that move be completed, Lazio are expected to target Alfonso Pedraza as a replacement on the left flank.

title: Liverpool's best loan player now EXPECTED to leave
description: Liverpool took the decison to offload several midfield talents last summer. We saw outgoing deals concluded for James McConnell and Harvey Elliott - who left on loan - while Tyler Morton was sold to L...
fullText:
Liverpool took the decison to offload several midfield talents last summer.

We saw outgoing deals concluded for James McConnell and Harvey Elliott - who left on loan - while Tyler Morton was sold to Lyon.

Another player who was loaned out is Luca Stephenson. The 22-year-old had spent the previous campaign with Dundee United in Scotland - impressing as their young player of the year.

Defying predictions that he had no future at Anfield, the young Englishman ended up signing a new contract last summer and was also brought into the side for preseason.

Stephenson then concluded another loan move to Dundee United - where has once again been excellent. Indeed with Elliott, McConnell and others struggling, there is little doubt that Stephenson is the best Liverpool performer out on loan this term.

Shop the goalkeeper range today

Shop the third kit range today!

His form has led to speculation that Liverpool may well seek to cash in next summer. A new report in the Athletic now claims that several Championship clubs are sniffing around Stephenson with a view to concluding a deal in 2026.

‚ÄúStephenson is Liverpool‚Äôs best-performing loan player and is growing in value during a second season in Scotland,‚Äù the report reads.

‚ÄúLiverpool extended the 22-year-old right-back‚Äôs contract by a further 12 months before he rejoined Dundee United and he‚Äôs transformed from the young player of the season to the best player of the season so far.

‚ÄúStephenson is expected to see out the campaign at Tannadice but is attracting interest from Championship clubs and is expected to leave Liverpool on a permanent deal in the summer.‚Äù

Stephenson signed for the Reds‚Äô academy from Sunderland back in 2018 - inking a first professional deal back in 2020. This season he has been in very good form for the Tangerines - giving Liverpool a chance to receive a cash boost for his services next summer.

title: Mets get matter-of-fact update on Cody Bellinger in free agency
description: New York seems to be the destination.
fullText:
Mets get matter-of-fact update on Cody Bellinger in free agency originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Cody Bellinger seems likely to spend 2026 in the Big Apple.

The New York Yankees are in the running to bring Bellinger back after a prodigious 2025 season.

The New York Mets appear the biggest threat to steal Bellinger away from the Bronx.

MLB.com's Mark Feinsand reported as much in a new article on Thursday night. He sees these as the two ballclubs leading the pursuit of Bellinger.

"The Mets have been among the teams most often connected to Bellinger, and after trading Brandon Nimmo and Jeff McNeil, the need for an outfielder (or two) is clear," Feinsand writes. "The two New York teams seem like the obvious fits for Bellinger, though the Angels, Blue Jays and Dodgers remain in the mix."

MORE:¬†Team USA's projected WBC lineup is incredible

Feinsand also provided an update on the potential timeline for a Bellinger contract.

"Bellinger settled on a shorter-term deal the last time he hit the free-agent market, but with no qualifying offer attached to him as he enters his age-30 season, he‚Äôs likely to wait as long as he can until he finds the long-term deal that has evaded him," Feinsand wrote.

That could be a way for the Mets to differentiate themselves. If they come to the table with a longer-term deal for Bellinger, that could accelerate the wait time to getting a signature.

Nothing is a given. Bellinger may decide he doesn't want to leave Yankee Stadium. But if he wants to try somewhere new, Queens may hold the answer.
